There are several stores and online retailers where you can find reef-safe and mineral-based sunscreen options. Here are a few options to consider:

1. Specialty outdoor retailers like REI or Patagonia often carry a selection of eco-friendly sunscreens. 2. Natural food stores like Whole Foods or Natural Grocers may also carry a variety of eco-friendly sunscreens. 3. Online retailers like Amazon or Thrive Market offer a wide range of eco-friendly sunscreens that you can purchase from the comfort of your own home. 4. Brands like All Good, Badger Balm, and Sun Bum offer mineral-based sunscreens that are reef-friendly. 5. Some hotels and resorts have started offering eco-friendly sunscreens to their guests, so it's worth checking with your accommodations to see if they offer any options. Remember to always check the label and avoid harmful chemicals to ensure that you are choosing a sunscreen that is safe for you and the environment.
